alert.note: Alert for Morris (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 09 at 10:14AM EDT until April 10 at 5:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New Jersey... Rockaway River At Boonton Below Resvr affecting Morris County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Rockaway River At Boonton Below Resvr. * WHEN...Until tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, Flooding occurs on Vail Road in Montville. The Road heading into Parsippany is subject to closures. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM EDT Saturday the stage was 5.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:00 AM EDT Saturday was 6.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage tomorrow morning and continue falling to 4.3 feet Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 5.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 6.0 feet on 06/22/2003. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (8 am) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sun Mon Stg Time Date Rockaway River Boonton Below R 5.0 5.9 Sat 9 am 5.0 4.6 MSG crested &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1015 PM EDT.
